text: Draft in taster at Kennet Square brew pub, clear golden with nice white head, replicates a German pils precisely, not my favorite pils I prefer the primal but overall great brew.
Draft at Lizard Pennsula Ohio Winking Lizard. Not much aroma Thin white head with film on glass. Light golden in color. Very grainy in taste. Very drinkable Smooth. Very nice for a pilsner.

A nice crisp German pilsner. Head comes back on each drink. Excellent body. No off flavors. Malt crisp and light noble hops. Perfectly done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

If you dont like pilsners, dont bother drinking this even if the only reason youre tasting it is to be able to add another beer to the list of beers youve tried. Or if you think youll suddenly like pilsners.

Bottle at BBE, had this many times but never ticked her for some reason. Pours a clear golden with active carbonation and nice white head. Notes of crisp malt, lemon rind, lime, cracker, flowers and perfect grain. Fire pils.

Not much of a nose, and I prefer the look of a filtered beer than unfiltered. However, it has a nice, white head and lacing. The mouthfeel is creamy and offers a nice balance of Pilsner malt and hops. Overall, I like it better than Victorys Prima, but Troegs, Stoudts, and Sly Fox (all in the same area) offer good Pilsners, too. To me, its a nice one during this segue from Indian Summer into the autumn. Cheers!
On Tap at BitterCreek Alehouse Sofy light pale yellow, somewhat hazy. Thick blankets of white lacing coating the glass. Typical light malt flavors. Slight soapy s[icy hop bite. Good
Grain and grass with hints of fruit and a lightly floral aroma. Top tier in the pils word for sure! Crisp flavorful finish.

Pours a nice golden yellow color with a minimal fizzy white head. Aromas of grains, straw, hops, and a hint of fruit. Flavor is a nice crisp pilsner taste. Starts grainy with touches of pepper and fruit and finishes with a mellow hop.

Hey, it actually smells like Hallertau, resembling honeysuckle, apricot, flowers, persimmon, etc. The body gives it away as American, more slick and syrupy and less savory, less gassy, and lacks the hard mineral quality found across Franconian lager. Its hoppy, aromatic, the yeast profile is clean, and the flavor balance is close. From draft at Churchkey in 2016, and from growler in 2012.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey during the Victory 20th anniversary event. Clear straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of pils malt, citrus, herbs. Tastes of pils malt, citrus, wheat and hay, light yeast. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
One of my favorite pilsners ever from the best lager brewer in America. Have had many different incarnations of this beer and the majority have been stellar.

Draft at Khyber Pass. Hazy gold pour with a large frothy white head. Lasting slim layer with waves of lace. Mild amber fruit and lightly toasted bready malts. Notes of apricot, kiwi, pineapple, clementine, dandelion, and blonde caramel. Challah french toast. Yeasty breadiness feels properly German but without any funk. Much fuller than your standard pils. Better than anticipated.

On draught at Winking Lizard. The beer pours a clear pale golden color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily to a film. Short strings of lacing. Aroma of grassy hops, fruit and malt. Light-bodied with an herbal hops character and notes of fruit and bready malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a spicy hops aftertaste. Pretty good all around.
Aroma of grain, some floral. Blonde and clear, light bodied. Mild earthy hops flavor, slightly nutty finish.

Draft (Tria Taproom, Philly).
Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is light to medium yellow. Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread), lightly to moderately hoppy (honeysuckle flowers, herbs). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.
A very enjoyable nose on this one, very German without any American give-aways. Doesnt excel quite as much in the other departments, being a little watery and lacking in head retention and less than lip-smacking (but still well-balanced), but its a really nice quaffer that holds up to a lot of authentic Franconian lagers (and is better than plenty of them too). Nice stuff.

Draught, smallish head, clear palish yellow color, aroma of honey and vanila with hints of spice and wood., aromatic honey flavor with a medium herbal bitterness and a light sourness. Simple pleasant pilsener, nice to drink.

Tap. Spalt Hallertau version. Says its a Keller on the menu. Pours lightly hazy golden, small off white head, great lacing. Aroma is grassy, hints of citrus, grain, bread. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, citrus kick over grass and grain. Light body.

Hazy, citrine. 
Light body with matching faint flavor, refreshing mouthfeel, long palate. 
Crisp, dry and very bitter. 
Yeasty, hoppy, touch of honey in background. 
Victory makes better pils. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma skunk
Appearance golden, clear, frothy, white foam, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, 
Palate light body, soft carbonation, 
Overall nothing great but not bad I would not suggest this beer to a friend

Draft. Golden body with a frothy white head. Aroma of grass, toasted grain, biscuit and a touch of canned vegetables. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/sticky texture, lively carbonation. Taste of grass, straw, grain, floral hops and a hint of DMS. Clean, crisp, though it leans toward the hefty side, but not as much as Prima Pils. In fact, I liked this better than Prima which I need to revisit.

16 oz. pour at Holy Grale. Aroma: Thoroughly grassy and a little peppery; semi dry crackery malts are pretty dialed back. Appearance: Slightly hazy yellow pour with lively carbonation holding up a rocky white head; the head settles into a thin skin. Flavor: Very grassy up front with cracker playing a bit bigger role; cracker fades towards the finish, which becomes more peppery and very dry. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: An excellent American pils; definitely one to try if you see it on tap.
Spalt Select. Very earthy, a bit heavier body and more lingering bitterness than prima pils.

Draught usually at Deep Ellum, over the years, most recently at Brava, 7/2/15Clear, straightforward light-amber/gold body has a medium amount of fairly well-retained whtie head.Noble hops! Wow. An American brewer still brewing a beer with non-American hops?? Hard to believe. Nicely attenuated pils malts lend honey and very light bread, while the spicy, leafy, fresh, herbal hops are neither over or underdone. Clean, straightforward and elegant with no flaws or alcohol.Flavor provides snappy, spicy and herbal hops with a moderate amount of bitterness stretched across lean, but not too dry pils malt that give off honey and very light crackery/doughy flavors. Hay, straw, grass; all the delicious flavors of old world pilsners and every bit as clean and dry. Much less bitter/resinous/punchy than Prima and I almost always immediately order this when I see it. A real treat in its simplicity and freshness. Medium to medium light bodied, with a soft, yet well-carbonated texture.

Pours light orange-yellow with a one finger white head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of freshly baked bread, freshly cut grass, pine, floral hops,pils malts, light honey, and some sweet malts. Taste is pils malts, grassy hops, bready malts, pine, herbal hops, honey sweet malts, and some citrus. Has a medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and a semi bitter, semi dry, medium-long finish. Overall, a excellent, world class pils that is my new favorite of the style .
draft, finally the elusive braumeiser pils in draft. Extremely clean flavor, lightly malted, very light hop prescense, moderate to high carbonation. Very light and balanced. Neat.

Golden with a nice white head. Aroma of bread, crackers, grass, lemons. Flavor followed, nice firm hoppy finish and a little more dry than the Prima Pils. Moderate and refreshing body with the right level of carbonation.
Draught from Blind Tiger. Golden pour white head. A nice lil pilsner with a bit of hops bite.

On tap at the brew pub in Downingtown, PA. Pours light clear golden color with white head. Aroma is light malt, citrus, grassy floral hops. Flavor starts with a light earthy biscuity malt flavor and fades to a grassy, herbal, floral hop flavor with light lemon notes. Finishes with a nice citrus flavor with some yeastiness. Possibly the best Pilsner Ive had. Really nice !

Mini growler from Bed Stuy Beer Works. Pours clear straw-colored yellow, small head. Aroma is fresh grassy hops, toasted bread, lightly nutty, citrusy, delicious. Taste is gulpable orange and bready/crackery malts, herbal hops, pleasantly dry. Round mouth feel but not syrupy, and good carbonation. Love this.

Draft at Plan B West Hartford. Pours a clear yellow color with a white head and some lacing. Aroma is hoppy, grass, some pine. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is bitter, hoppy, grass, some sweet bready malt, with a crisp, bitter finish. Very nice.
On tap at Xfinity. Foamy yellow pour. Aroma of malt, corn, wheat, hops and fruits. Well balanced. An easy drinker. And delicious. Nice.

Transfer from BA review on 3-21-12 - 
Served in 10 oz chalice glass

Appearance  Served a hazy yellow color with a large white head that faded fast. Upon fading a little lacing was left on the glass.

Smell  The smell is more citrus hop with a nice bit of wheaty bready aroma mixed with a pepper spicy aroma and an ever so lighter tropical fruit aroma. 

Taste  The taste is a bit of sweeter wheat malt up front. The hop flavor really then starts to come into play. Very lemony citrus in nature with a bit of pine. There is a nice peppery flavor that comes more toward the end of the taste. The mix of the peppery lemon and wheat go on to take the brew to its taste finish and leave a rather crisp flavor on the tongue as an aftertaste.

Mouthfeel  The mouthfeel is on the medium to lighter side with a good level of carbonation. It is rather good for the style, but nothing of extraordinary greatness.

Overall  This was a refreshing brew that was very easy to drink. Good for a nice sunny warm day while sitting and lounging around outside.

On tap at Brunzies. Beany hops and honey sweet with peas. Light pilsener malts. Medium pale golden clear with thin white lacing head. Medium body with medium-light carbonation. Light sweet pilsener malts with a bit of beany (noble) hop flavors. Solid pils with clean hoppy after.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Armsby Abbey (Worcester, MA) au coût de 5,00$. Arôme: Odeur de céréale avec une pointe herbacée. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale avec une pointe de citron. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréale en arrière goût. (Rating #5538)

Good example of a pilsner, possibly a little more on the bitter/hoppy side than expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gold pour, small white head. Big fruity fresh aroma, crisp fresh lemony flavor. A great pilsner.

I havent rated this yet?! Anyway, I rectified that with a new pint at The Brass Tap - U Square. Pours a completely clear, brighter gold with a small white head. Very clean - pale and pils malts, straw, grass, maybe a hint of lemon zest. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a clean, refreshing mouthfeel. Great pils. This one didnt quite hit the spot like it has in the past, but Ill re-rate when I get another because I wonder how fresh it was.

Tap at gbd in dc march 20214
Pours pale orange witb a small soapy white head and sparse lacing. Nose is very grassy damn like hay and farm field in the fall. Big time l eaffy grassy german hops here huge! Nice crisp spicy hop flavors and crisp body. Im pretty impressed.! Not overly bitter. Very grassy and l eaffy. Very nice pils!!! Wish I could get tbis near me!

Drier and crisper than a Bohemian Pilsener with a bitterness that tends to linger more in the aftertaste due to higher attenuation and higher-sulfate water. Lighter in body and color, and with higher carbonation than a Bohemian Pilsener. Modern examples of German Pilsners tend to become paler in color, drier in finish, and more bitter as you move from South to North in Germany.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My Bottom Line:
A herbal hop zing pierces this Kellerbiers wet hay, as whispers of citrus fruit and honey create even more merriment.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy sheet of foam covers the hazy straw, lacing beautifully.
-If I have to find something to improve, I could say the body could be drier.
-The nose is surprisingly awash in malt aromas.
-This is not as slender and elegant as many German Pilsener, which is why I dubbed it a Kellerbier. Feels more rural in its intensity and flavor display.

On tap at Armsby Abbey.
Light straw yellow. Aroma is of grass, citrus, grain, spice. Flavor is more lemony but a nice balance of the same other than slight metallic notes. Light mouthfeel. Very nice US pils.

One of my favorite pilsners ever from the best lager brewer in America. Have had many different incarnations of this beer and the majority have been stellar. Cant wait to try the new experimental hop one in Raleigh in the new year.
Pours a straw color with a small foamy white head. Notes of wheat, pine, and fresh air. There is not a lot to this beer.
A pilsner with a nice hop presence, beautifully clear yellow, and shockingly amzing lacing. This is a must try.
Pretty good pils. A lot less pine than their most popular pilsner. This was a little bit more traditional German which was enjoyable but not as great as I had hoped.
Clear gold with white head. Aroma of sweet biscuity malt, grass, and saltines. Taste is moderate bitterness over light malts. Light-medium body.

Crystal clear yellow pour with a white head. The aroma and flavor are standard American pilsner. I get a lot of biscuit and cracker notes as well as some light grass and a hint of citrus. The flavor has a small amount of bitterness and is very clean and crisp. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Draft. Clear deep golden color, fluffy white head. Aroma of crisp apple skins. Taste is light citrus, spice, honey. Nice.

Pours yellow with a sparse white head. Not much on the nose. Taste is standard pils, but clean and crisp. Thin. Not bad, but I'm not really a pils guy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Beachwood BBQ. Golden pour with a white head. Crisp pale malt, floral hops, and light soap on the nose. Biscuit, cracker, grass, and a touch of yeast. Flavor is lightly soapy up front, but does have a good floral hop note, light malt sweetness, and a crisp finish. Mild grass, some biscuit, and cracker.
Draft at Brews Brothers  gold  crisp .. .. Damn fine pils, I could drink buckets of this .... Why is a grapefruit called a grape of a fruit?

5/04/2011: Victory Braumeister Pilsner... Aroma: Soft Lemon peel and citrus, biscuit malt. Appearance: Hazy golden color; really frothy off white head. Flavor: Biscuit malt, mild citrus bitterness, lacks crispness for a pils. Palate: Medium, soft, good mouthfeel. Overall: Blah, ill pass on a second...
Draught (5.7% ABV) at Dutchs in Cincinnati, Ohio. Rating #222 for this beer.
on tap at CT, clear golden yellow pour with short white foam, aroma of grassy hops, nice bodied smooth flavors of grass, straw, metal, some citrus on finish

Growler from JCs. Clear, deep golden body with a clingy, lacy bright white head, nice subtle American hops in the nose, sharpening up a little in the mouth with strong herbal and lighter woody and grassy notes. Medium body sharp and very crisp, dry finish with a little bread and a hint of metal, quenching and sharp with an atonal, chalky bitterness that lingers.  Lightly floral, some cracker.  Clean and refreshing. One of the better American takes on Pils.

On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford.
Appearance: Clear golden body with a creamy off-white head.
Aroma: The aroma is restrained with a white gummy bear aroma, a touch of lemons, and hints of malts.
Taste: Semi-dry with hints of lemon and floral notes and a mild malty body.
Palate: Medium bodied with high carbonation.
Overall: This is a good pils, but it doesnt excite me. I know pils arent the most exciting style, but this is no Wright Pils.

On tap at The Common Table in Dallas. Pour is clear yellow with a small white head and decent lacing. Grassy, crackery, biscuity, snappy, slightly herbal, and doughy aroma. Taste is grassy, cracker, biscuit, dough, slightly floral, a bit of mineral, and chalkiness with a crisp bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Clean and tasty stuff.
Growler from Adam, pours yellow with nice head. Aroma is light bread and crisp hops, taste is similar, great shower beer!

Draft at Fermentation. Clear golden pour with a fluffy white head. Piney, floral and grass aroma with slightly sweet pale maltiness. Zesty, spicy hop flavor with pale grainy malt characteristics. Pretty solid and refreshing.

Tap at Sugar Maple.  Light haze, yellow tan, hint of green body.  Steady, thick white head.  Clean, light to medium bodied.  Fresh grassy hops.  Authentic bohemian taste, very well done.  Peppery, nice light golden malt, yeasty pungency.  Solid example of the style.

Pours a clear yellow on tap with thin white lacy cap that laces nicely. Aroma of traditional pils malts and German yeast. Taste follows, but slightly bitter hop notes and earthy qualities. Solid for a pilsiner.
Pours a clean gold with fluffy white head and some lace. Nose of honey, pilsner malt, grassy hops, butter. Clean, mild bitterness. Sessionable.
Hazy pale yellow in the glass. Noble hop aroma with great grain and bread malt flavors. Balance is good. Strong noble hop presence. Good stuff.
On draught.  Cloudy yellow pour with a thin fizzy head.  Aroma of pepper and yeast.  Light to medium body with a nice sharp pepper finish.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Wow, what a pilsner. Lovely hoppy bitterness to it but well balanced still.

On tap. Pours a fairly clear straw gold with a thinner eggshell head that settles to a ring and leaves some intricate, clingy lacing. Nose involves notes of honey, doughy yeast, and spicy noble hops. Lightly sweet with a pronounced but not overwhelming bitterness. Lighter bodied, bright, tingly, actively carbonated with a fairly lengthy bitter finish. A nice light bodied brew.

Draught at Baileys Taproom in Portland (from notes). Good floral, lemony, white grapefruit aroma. Initial contains some straw, light-medium malt with 
very subtle citrus hopping. Finishes with the floral character again and a  lingering grassy bitterness. Pretty darn good.
On tap at the Lodge, Hilton Head Island. Great selection of beers. Hits fine notes of a pilsner. Very drinkable.

Point Brugge tasting. I know I'm really underrating this one but I just don't like pilsner beers. Surprised to see the lacing on this one. Minimal nut there. The rest is a flavorful pilsner. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler from Bierkraft. Mostly clear golden yellow color with a small white head. Excellent hoppy aroma of grass and some herbal notes. Great pilsner taste with a crisp clean malt base and grassy hop bitterness. Lighter on the body with a dry mouthfeel and average carbonation. Crazy drinkable and good.
Another good pilsner by victory. Continuing to like this style even more. Nice and easy to drink but nice spicy hops and small floral notes. Compare to prima pils and sly fox pikeland pils.
On tap at Victory Brew Pub. Pour cloudy light gold with white head. Floral, grass, earth, resin. Moderately bitter. Crisp, light body. Pretty good.

Draft.  Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized white head.  The aroma is pale malt, herbal, lightly floral and grassy.  The flavor is pale malt, grainy, herbal, hints of spice and hay.  Fairly light and clean.  This is just not a style I enjoy.

Draught pour from Churchkey; slightly hazy golden with a white head. Nose of crisp, grassy hops and lovely grainy honey malts. Some crisp apple notes. Not as soapily hoppy as Prima; more of a malt/hop balance. Jesus, I love this beer.

16oz at Churchkey DC pours a clear gold with some lacing white head.  Nose of honey, hay, green apple, malt, light bread.  Flavor is malty, bready, sweet, honey, light lemon, hay.  Medium bodied, crisp finish.

Pint on tap at Tellers. Mildly hazy yellow orange color. Minimal white head. Nice grassy hop flavor, kind of a significant dankness that I like. Much mustier, greener, more herbal than Prima; I like it. Light fruity even. Little bitterness, more savory. Smooth, light carbonation, medium body, maybe a bit more carbonation would be appropriate, here. Tasty pils, though.
This poured a golden yellow color with a white head.  Aroma was cracker, dough, and crips german hops.  Flavor was similar but more put together and extremely crisp.  Another great pils from Victory.
Draft to taster. Looks decent; a hazy yellow with white lacing. Smells and tastes slightly sweet and hoppy with an average mouthfeel. Easy to drink. A decent example of the style.

On draft at Capones in Philadelphia.

The beer is hazy yellow with minimal head and lcing. The aroma is pretty weak, with some faint pilsner scents. The flavor is pretty good, with a healthy malt showing. Mild bitterness is present in the finish. Overall, a decent pilsner and pretty drinkable.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 04-23-2011

Draft @ tap & mallet, rochester.  Very slightly hazed but probably transparent golden, I may need glasses.  Lacey white head.  Nice cracker nose, with some punches of hop spice...the nose is actually remarkably satisfying, not sure why.  Flavors follow suit, more biscuity crackers and snappy hop notes...combining quite delightful.  The body is medium-full, nicely clean and leaving trails of green-ish hop notes clinging to the taste buds.  This beer is exactly what I wanted it to be, and what exemplifies the goodness that I know I like but rarely find in most lagers.  Nicely clinging bitterness in the finish.

Pours a clear straw color with a thin white head. By the way this is a Danish style tick stolen from dasilkys glass. Fucker. Aromas of noble hops, some straw. Flavor is crisp, delicate, slightly grassy with a bitter finish. Decent.

growler.  clear gold with a big head.  nice tangy, grassy nose with minimal honey.  flavor is bitter lime and lemon.  mouthfuls of grass.  light on any malt sweetness.  dry finish with light body.  very bitter finish.
Draft at Roosters beak. Golden pour with a long lasting white top. Scent is bready and grassy. Taste is biscuits, bread,  and grass. Nice
Growler at the RBSG LA grand tasting. Nice blond, very nice grassy Helletauer nose. Really light biscuity malt. Very hoppy, but in a traditional noble sense. Nice balance. Good stuff.

On tap several times at Alla Spina. Pours glowing pale gold with a foamy white head. Aroma of sweet, buttery corn on the cob and some lovely Pilsner malt and grassy hops. Sweet, buttery corn flavor with a crispy, refreshingly light body. Finishes clean and a tad sweet. Overall a very drinkable, very sessionable pilsner. Well done.
a great beer. greenish golden. pure white head. pilsner malt amd bitter aroma and taste. nice bitter backend. great lacing. enjoyable on every occasion.

Tap. Pours pale yellow with thin, creamy white head; short retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is straw and biscuit malt, grassy hops, citrus fruit, faint herbs, and light yeast. Flavor is tart malt forward with good supporting hops (light bitterness) and finishing citrus (mostly grapefruit); crisp, dry finish. Light body, medium carbonation, and low warmth.

Aroma: Soft malt with hints of bready yeast and citrus
Appearance: Clear, pale gold with nice white head
Palate: Light body, crisp texture, dry bitter finish, average carbonation
Taste: Light sweetness with medium bitterness. Fairly balanced.
Overall: A great, well balanced pils. Very crisp and clean.

Draft Mostly clear straw-colored lager with a small, fizzy, white head. The aromatic highlights are apricot and lemon peel. Medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation. Very well-balanced, the flavor presents pale malts intertwined with citrusy, tannic bitterness. Crisp, modestly sweet finish.
Tap @ The Pony Bar, NYC. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt, grass, notes of caramel and hops. Nice and refreshing with an oily palate.
Gold pour with a white head.  Nose is bitter, hops, delicious.  Easy oj the palate, great hop notes, spices, and florals.
(draught) clear bright gold with almost no head. Nose of earth, herbs, cilantro and basil. Taste of light coriander, Herbal, no butter, refreshing an light. Good pils!
Tap. Yellowy golden with no real head. Smells grainy and sour. Light sweetness with a dry finish. A little watery.
Growler togo pours golden with abunch white head.  Aromas of straw some grass and hay.  Flavor is slightly bitter and body is light.  Finish is very crisp

Tap at Stillwaters OfLove and Regret. Light golden pour with a foamy white head.  Laces excellently. Aroma of bitter European hops.  Taste is classic pilsner on steroids.  Crisp, bitter, and refreshingly malty but amplified.  Quite flavorful given the ABV.  Well crafted.

Draught at Churchkey. A stupendous pils with a golden pour and rich, pillowy head. Nose and flavor bring gorgeous fresh noble hop presence, crisp balance; like crisper, cleaner, and more complex Prima. Stupendous.
On tap at Churchkey. This is hands down one of the best Pilseners Ive ever quaffed. Amazing vibrant juicy fruitiness with amazing crispness in the body. Puffy and fluffy carbonation- perfect!
Draft at the brewery.  Fresh, beautiful thick pilsner head looking almost like  whipped cream.  Dry, grassy, quenching.  So nice to get a real pils.

On tap at Draught House. Pours a hazy gold with a small off white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is faint wheat and corn. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet malt and light hop and nice crisp finish. Easy to drink a good variation of the pils.

Draft at Churchkey. Poured a translucent yellow/orange color with notes of sweet malts with a crisp finish. Notes of biscuit in the flavor. Refreshing, albeit a bit early in the season for a beer like this for me.

On tap at Prohibition Pig. Appearance: Beautiful sunny yellow with white head and nice lacing. Very elegant citrusy hops, hay and honey malts. Exactly what you expect from a good pils. Crispy hops, honey malt along with a lively carbonation and a light body makes it highly drinkable.

On tap at Sterling Tavern in Buffalo, NY.  I thought this was really quite good and a great example of the style.  Poured a clear straw gold and had a very smooth, crisp mouthfeel.  Tasted of basic light hops, hay, honey.  Simple but very well done.

On tap at Beachwood BBQ. It pours cloudy yellow with a nice white head. The aroma is lemongrass, grains and menthol. Super aromatic. The flavor is grainy with lemon peel, lemongrass and a touch of eucalyptus with a strong earthy, citrusy, bitter finish. Very nice kellerbier.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma is freash and hoppy...lightly spicy and delicate hops...pils malt.  Flavor has very nice bitterness and good spicy notes...not overly malty which i like.  Mouthfeel is light and the finish is crisp and bitter.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2014 Bottle, gold pour, white head, nose is grassy, taste is grassy and lemon, crisp finish.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Pale golden body, slightly hazy, mid-sized white head.  Good coverage as the lacing worked its way down the glass.  Bright grassy hops rounded out by lemon-citric notes and light grainy malts. Light bodied, mild bitterness, nice clean, crisp finish.  One of the greatest beers ever made.
Draft. Pours light orange with a small white head. Taste is light and crisp with light bitterness. Solid.
Aroma of sourdough and slight grape.  Pours light with a good chewy head.  Tastes of nice bread, slight lemon and baking soda.  Great pilsner.  A much better showing than their prima.

Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a tight white head.  The nose is toasted bread crust and raw dough mixed in as a lightly sweet honey balance with a citric hop in back.  The taste is sweet grains up front, lightly toasted, very balanced with subtle nuances of honey.  Citric hops accompany the light bitterness in the finish.  Light body with a playful feel of carbonation and a dry crisp finish.  Very good stuff!

Draft at Rattle N Hum.  Oh yeah.  This shit rocks!  Im a huge Prima Pils fan, so finding this little gem on tap was a pleasant surprise.  The body is a cloudy, glowing, rich golden color.  A minimal head of smooth, off-white foam settles quickly to a thin ring, leaving virtually no lace behind.  The first sniff reveals exactly what I was hoping for....super fresh, doughy, malty, hoppy deliciousness!  Notes of fresh, softly sweet, ultra yeasty bread dough lay the baseline.  From there, a mildly eggy and sulfuric undertone nods to the ungespundet beers of Bamberg.  Grassy noble hops lend the right amount of dry, peppery bite to balance the nose.  It simple smells comfortable and inviting, fresh and quaffable, better than 99% of the Pils made domestically.  Flavors follow suit, delectably balanced, showing the perfect ratio of sweet dough and bitter grass, with that eggy, yeasty twang that I rarely get to experience.  Pepper and grass grow on the finish, letting you know that this is indeed a relative of Prima Pils, but there is more restraint shown here than in its big brother.  I cant say anything negative about the palate, as the even-keeled body sports a cleaning, zippy carbonation that leaves the mouth slightly dry, begging for the next glass.  I crushed pint after pint after pint of this stuff, and was perfectly happy to do so.  Excellent beer.  Victory knows Pils!

Draught at Rattle N Hum.
Pours hazy golden with a small head.
Taste of malt, hay and a hint of malt. Nice roughness to it!

Growler.  Served at around 45F.

Pours lightly hazy yellow/gold with a one finger active white head that recedes to a very tiny cap and leaves some spots of lacing behind.

Aroma is grassy and grainy with notes of lemon peel, a bit of fruit, slight hint of sulfur, pretty robust aroma for a Pils and of very good strength.

Flavor generally follows suit, some lemony citrus, grass & grains, cereal, a touch of fruit and sulfur, a bit of sweetness in the middle and finishes with some really nice crisp bitterness.  One of the tastiest Pils Ive had.

Mouthfeel is light/medium bodied, rather creamy for the style but with good carbonation.

Damned good, and I mean damned good Pilsner.  Absolutely loaded with flavor, great aroma too.  Really stoked to get a chance to try this!

Poured at Jimmys No. 43 tasting.  Very nice.  Full flavored, not bland, with interesting fruit and grain notes.  It is called a pils, but RB puts it into a category Im not that familiar with, and there it comes in at #2 (as of this writing).
on tap at proof.  funky grain aroma.  same in the taste with light malt and strong hop backing.  drinkable, grass, fruity yeast.  pretty good despite the initial off vibe.
Pour is a very hazy light yellow with thin white head. Smell is wheaty wet hay citrusy floral. Taste is mild up front grapefruit a little funk and a clean dry hop finish. Good mouthfeel.

Draught from Spirits Point Beach. Poured a thicker yellow/gold body underneath an average to large foamy bright white head. Aroma of cereal and grains along with dry hop cones. Full chewy mouthfeel, average carbonation, very big for a pils. Flavor of cereal, bread, drier crisp hops. Good stuff and Im surprised how full the mouthfeel is on this one.

On tap pours hazy yellow golden with a small white head. Aroma of lemongrass, grain, honey, and slight malt. Taste is a clean crisp grain and malt nice earthy hop presence with slight honey. Nice, drinkable.
Pours light gold with nice hints of hops and malts.  The malts show nicely with a fresh crispness but the hopes sits in the background very nicely.  Good crisp finish.

Draft at the brewery.  Golden color, aroma of cereal hops and malts, taste of earthy tones.  Good balance, fresh, crisp, clean taste.  Earthy taste, medium bodied, slight bitter finish.  Refreshing brew.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2012 Draft. Pour is a bright yellow with a straw white head, good lacing/retention. Aroma is lots of grassy/ctrius hops, fresh bread, biscuit. Taste is very crisp, with a nice amount of hop bitterness with low sweetness. High carbonation on the palate, light bodied, bitter finish. Nice.

Re-rate: draft at brewery in proper glassware. Better appearance and fresher, danker taste.

Pizzeria Paradiso- Dupont, DC 16oz mug ($3): Pours a slightly hazed golden color with a nice white head. Aroma is of dry Germanic hops and a whole lot of grain. Basically, this is not a clean beer. It is grainy as all hell. It is also quite bitter. The hops are more prominent here than in most examples of the style, and they leave a lingering astringent aftertaste. Aside of that there is some lemongrass, more grain, and a little bit of delicious. A good brew from an excellent brewer.

18 July 2011, tap at the brewery. very pale yellow and almost a faint haze. Nice bitter pils nose. thin, slightly creamy body, slightly fizzy. Surprisingly bitter for a pils. grassy and some lemon rind hints. dry grassy finish. very nice!

draft @ the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy flavor with grassy hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty grainy finish with hoppy hints.
tap at Blind Tiger - dark brown pour, this is a pils? Delcious floral hops, caramel malts, pine & citrus, dry & astr. Smooth, soft body.
Awesome pils. Light and refreshing. Pale malts. Not too complicated a gives great contrast to other hoppier beers.
Not my favorite victory beer but good nonetheless.  As far as Pilsners are concerned very good beer but not my style

Shaker pint draft at the Pizza Port in Carlsbad, California.  Pour is a darker copper brown with a slight haze.  Smallish off white head leave behind nice lacing.  The aroma is grass, lightly toasted wheat bread, citrus and some earthiness.  The flavor features the toasted malt, very full and flavorful with the grass, citrus and earthiness all mixed in perfectly.  Really great depth of character, while still maintaining a great crispness and freshness.  Palate is light to medium bodied, crisp carbonation and a clean mineral finish.  Super clean, full flavored, easy drinking.
UPDATED: JUL 25, 2011 tap.  awesome beer.  grassy, crisp, dry, herbal hop notes.  some light toasted herbs and earth.   very refreshing.  easy to drink.   liked quite a bit.

Draft. Poured clear golden color with an average fizzy white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate grass and malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth dry texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bitterswwet finish of moderate duration. Good above average beer.

Draft at Abbey.  Golden color with a thin white head.  This was excellent for the warm weather.  Grassy, light sweet corn, bready notes,  and a dry hoppy finish.  Very clean and refreshing.  Nice beer.
Pours golden with a really big head. Aroma has a big metallic scent. Taste also feels metallic and it lingers as well. Not my favorite beer.

On tap at the Brick Store Pub. Pours a pale, hazy yellow with a small white head. The aroma is lemons, wheat, bananas, and spices. The flavor is a mild wheat malt sweetness and a subtle hop bitterness. The palate is light and effervescent. Overall, a clean and subtle pilsner; refreshing and crisp.
Pale yellow-whitish, with a white head.  Aroma is very grainy, light florals.  Taste is nice grassy, grain husks, light fruitiness.  Very good.

Clear golden pour with a fizzy white head. Grassy hop aroma, with a strong complement of biscuity malts. Taste is fragrant, floral, even a little herbal. Mainly grass and citrus hops, with typical doughy pils malts. Body is light and effervescent. Decent pils. Not really a big fan of the style, but this is pretty drinkable. Not quite as good as Prima Pils IMO.
Sampled at the brewvival 2011.  Pours a clear golden hue and faint minimal whitish head.  Fresh hop profile, but a little grassier than the headwaters.  And a bit dry on the finish.
Excellent pils.  Pours light gold with quickly dissipating white head.  Aroma is florals and grass.  Taste is hoppy bitters.  Very refreshing

On tap at the brewery. Reviewed from notes.

Pours a nice, crisp light golden color with a large-ish white head and a bunch of clingy lace on the way down. The nose brings forward a bit of grain underneath a pretty good amount of floral Noble hops. The taste is slightly bitter with some floral and herbal notes, but mostly a bit of grain. The feel is better, with great carbonation carrying the flavors with a nice crispness. Drinks quite well and shows again how well Victory can go with this style.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-21-2010

On tap at blue palms. Pours with a lightly hazed and oddly deep golden (even light copper) color with a white head. Aromas are grainy, grassy and bready with light melanoidins. Flavors are bitter, grassy and bready. Lively bubbles and dry.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2011 No notes on this one, but Ive drank it a bunch of times. Amazing stuff, my memory has clung to moments of wonder, whether the rich, dusty, hay-like grain that leads to a grassy and faintly barky bitterness or the lightly fizzy, uplifting citrus.

This is the best lager Ive ever had. When fresh, Its mindblowing how flavorful the grain is, makes Tipopils seem like a light beer.

A dark golden pils with a thin lacing moka head. Biscuitty malt aroma with nice saaz hops. In mouth, loads of biscuitty malts, good saaz and herbal hops, well balanced. On tap at Brewvival, Feb. 26 2011.
Draft. Pours amber with a white head. The aroma has pale crackery malts and light floral hoppy notes. The flavor is well balanced, with grainy malts and floral hops. Pretty good.

Draft at Rembrandts.

Pours a dark chestnut brown color with golden orange edges and a two finger frothy, pillowy white head that has excellent retention, only slowly fading into a lasting cap. The glass is left coated with chunks and rings of soapy lace. I was surprised that this was a pilsner before drinking it and was reassured several times by the bartender that this was the right beer.

Earthy aroma with subtle floral hops, grass and straw as well as a prominent malt presence that wasnt expected. Pilsner malt with hints of subtle biscuit, tofee and caramel in the nose.

Medium bodied with more of a malt presence than expected for the style. Earthy and crisp with floral hop bitterness and a nice dry character that lingers throughout into a sweet yet dry finish. Hints of grass and straw with some faint light fruit, notably apple and pear. Again, the malt backbone is strong with hints of nut, toast and caramel. The ABV is well masked without a trace of heat making this unique beer pretty quaffable.
On tap at Fathers Office. Poured a medium golden color with a smaller sized white head. Aromas of  malts. Light malt flavor balanced with hops. Creamy body that went down very easy. Decent brew

#1234 Draft, a couple times, with different hops each time. Beer does change, but fresh hop tones dominate all recipes in flavor and aroma. Usually pine, earthy and bit of citrus. Best of which rivals or exceeds prima pils(I gave a 4.6) range 3.8-4.6

Tap at the brewpub. Poured the color of straw with some haziness and a slight white head. Smells of hay, clover, bread, wheat. Has a big herbal hop taste with bread and clover, very easy to drink, its sparkly and effervescent.

On tap @ Rattle N Hum.
Yellow and mostly clear with a light white head. Light aroma, some citrus and light hop notes, light bodied and smooth, just a little bit of bitterness on the finish, along with a light wheat note. Smooth and crisp.

On draft at the Happy Gnome. Pale gold with a hint of haze and fairly strong carbonation. Great Continental noble hop aromas of herbs, cut grass, and lemon, along with a touch of crispy pilsner malt. Superbly hoppy flavours with more herbs, lemon tall grasses. Creamy pilsner malt notes shine through mid-sip, before things return to dank herbal hops on the finish. Solid bitterness with a light refreshing body. A truly exceptional pilsner.
on tap at the brewpub, pours light yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is pale malts and peppery hops.  Flavor is semi-sweet corn and pale malts, with a light zesty pepper finish.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2010 Enjoyed this one at Waterworks Restaurant in Philadelphia - only a few good beers but nice choices in those.  Great place which I would recommend for Dinner as well.  Beer reminds me of Prima Pils but more complex.  
My wife thought the appearance was only fair, but I thought it had a very crisp and clear character with a unique hue.  Was excited to see this one on tap!

I had it a second time at The Note in West Chester after my son and his band from Rockdale Music performed there.  The beer was intensely hoppy but balanced with a sweet honey character.  It had a beautiful lingering finish.  I have upgraded my rating above based on my second experience with it - I am looking forward to trying it again.  At The Note, I felt it might have been one of the best beers I have ever had!

On tap at Toronado SD. Pours a brilliantly clear straw color. Aroma is wonderful bready and grainy, with a hint of hops. Flavor is amazingly clean, with bready malt and grassy hops. So refreshing and good.

Draft: I totally dig this beer. Hazed yellow golden body. Stark white head. Grainy, grainy, goodness. It does not take many words to describe the beers flavors/aromas/etc.. But it is impossible to capture the pleasure of drinking such a finely crafted and subtle beer in words. Must find more...

Growler from The Village Beer Merchant Buffalo, NY: Clear straw colored body beneath a solid white head. Spicy saaz hop aroma with some underlying grass and lemon. Spicy and earthy hop flavors accompanied by a clean malt backbone. I wouldnt really say this is balanced though, pretty much all about saaz hops. Finishes dry with a lingering bitterness.

On tap at Rattle N Hum.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with a medium sized white head.  Crisp lemon and crackers, light grain.  Tastes like a good pils, which is a rarity for me as Im generally not a fan of the style.  This is far better than their Prima Pils however.  Grainy, a little light lemon.  Finishes up with a crackery, peppery bitterness.  Nice.

Served on draft at Beer Run in Charlottesville, VA, 6/21/10. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of bready, slightly doughy and toasty (is that possible?) malts, grassy hops and a very faint metallic note. The taste is pale, bready malts, grassy citrus hops. Well balanced and refreshing. Medium bodied. Nice beer.

On tap at Bierkraft. Aroma is citrusy sweet--lemon peel and coriander. Some crisp malt character.  A yellow to light gold mildly hazy body with a thin half inch white head and moderate persistence.  Very smooth citrus and sweet on the palate--a medium light body.  Citrus and flower-like hop flavor with a rounded hop bitterness, not too aggressive, that allows this otherwise sweet pilsner to finish relatively cleanly, with some lingering bitterness.  An expertly crafted beer and incredibly refreshing.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2013 On tap at fountainhead. This pours a slightly hazy golden with foamy white head. A big fresh hop aroma thats a touch green, mostly grassy and earthy notes. Wonderful big noble hop aroma. Flavor is loaded with noble hop character thats surprisingly rather bitter, really pleasant grassy hop notes, very crisp and clean. Man this almost too good, a really hoppy pils.

On tap, at brewery.  Pours with a slight haze in the pale yellow body under a creamy white head that left some delicate lacing.  Soft bready malt nose with some great fresh grassy hops.  A light hint of fluffy yeast.  Bright floral and grassy hops burst on the tongue with the fizzy prickly carbonation.  Pale bready maltiness with a soft well rounded flavor.  Light bodied and fizzy with great lingering fresh hops on the back end.  Great beer.  Why arent there more like this?

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2011 Tap at Victory. Pours a slight hazy yellow with a decent white head that has okay retention. Aroma is puppy breath, ocean, lemon. Taste is like watered down Prima Pils. Still full of soapy, biting, near metallic Saaz hops. But not too much else going on. Light-bodied, hoppy, refreshing, but the nose on this I just cant get over. 6/16/2010 5/3/7/4/13=3.2Growler fresh from the source. Pours a glowing, mostly clear golden with a massive white head. Very nice retention. Webby lace. Nose is ultra fresh flowers, zesty lemon, Saaz hop explosion, dried grapefruit rind. Taste is very quenching, Czech hop spice and dryness, not even grassy or herbal...more bitter citrus, fresh white pepper, hop flowers, pineapple. Pretty much awesome. No soapiness like is sometimes found in Prima Pils. Not too agressive, huge dough and biscuit. Amazing palate- bitter, quenching, fresh. Immensely sessionable. Really incredible.

Absolutely delicious.  Draught.  Poured golden yellow with medium white head.  Spring aroma, new grass and the fields.  Malty flavour, full body and lekker hop notes.  Well balanced.  Endless beer finish.  Would make a wonderful session beer.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
(Old BA rate - tap)
Clear light gold color and poured with a half-finger of white frothy head; good lacing throughout. Bready; nice enough touch of hops; pretty tame though. Great hop bitterness up front; dry; a bit doughy; earthy. Really good. Lightish; great carbonation; dry. Huge drinkability; thirst quenching; interesting; lovely stuff
Pours clear golden color with a white head. Aroma is honey, fruity, earthy, and a nice light spicy hops. Flavor is honey, toast, grain, and a floral peppery finish.

Growler purchased from Bierkraft in Brooklyn.

Appearance: Pours an attractive soft golden yellow with a slight cloudiness to it. 2 fingers of soft foam crown this pils.

Smell: Nice subdued hoppiness (almost like a fresh hop ale) and grass notes. Im impressed by how fresh the hops smell.

Taste: Large fresh hop presence with some bitterness. Lots of wet grass to balance out the typical pilsner malt. Truly a tasty pilsner.

Mouthfeel: Amazingly crisp and creamy at the same time!

Drinkability: No problems kicking this one back all night. A really nice session beer choice for those who like hops.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 11-30-2008

Growler, from Consumers Beverage (yes, Im drinking the WHOLE growler).  Boy, that previous rater should give himself an enema (preferably boiling lead) - 0.8 because its too hoppy?  Maybe I should go and re-rate all my DUTCH beers to 0.7 - 0.9 because theyre TOO FUCKING DUTCH.  Jesus.  Anyway, pours a somewhat flat-looking, oily gold, mostly clear, with a small fast-diminishing white head (2+).  Not a lot of aroma to it - slightly sweet, a nice fresh clover grassiness (6+).  The taste - not terribly hoppy (DutchDude:  were you comparing this to bottled water, you pussy-palated weenbag?) - its grassy, slightly catty, with just enough sweet grainy malt and vague fruity yeastiness to sort of balance it - hardly any alcohol presence at all.  Still, slick, slightly thick mouthfeel - it initially seems like it may amount to some sessionable hoppiness, but it just fades into a slightly tangy grassy-grainy mildness.  Drinkable, but not all that interesting - now if this IS a zwickel, that might explain the slightly earthy aftertaste.  Mehh.  (call me wrong - Im NOT rating this 0.8).  UPDATE - two pints into this growler, and man has it grown on me - Im bumping the taste+1 and the overall +2 - subtle, and a real dry earthiness to it.  Mmm - I WOULD have this again.

Ach! Is this nothing more than a marketing beer? Full of hops, yes, but what about balance? Why is there no malt presence? Or is it completely drowned in the hops? This is as close to a German pils as a plastic christmas tree is to the Schwartzwald. Tasted on tap in the US.
Probably the best pilsner beer Ive ever had.  Clear yellow color with a floral aroma.  Smooth with just a touch of crispness.  Flavor of hops, malts anad a touch of lemon.  Very nice.

Tap at Blind Tiger. Poured a light golden color. Nose is malty with a ton of hops. Flavor is all of the saaz hops, very malty then dry with a very  bitter finish. Great take on a style that I dont particularly care for.

I have notes on this beer a few different times in my backlog. Every time Ive had this beer, its fantastic. In fact, Id go so far as to say, its the best Pilsner that is regularly made in the US. Richly floral hops, snappy cracker malts, light honey, some fresh herbs and a touch of citrus. A bit of dusty yeast, but relatively clean. Just an all around amazing beer.
Light floral hop aroma. Hazy golden color with a small white head. Light hop beginning that last into the finish. Gets sweeter as time goes on. Light palate.

Tap at Fiddlers. Light yellow pour with a decent head. Crisp nose, grainy flavor with an ample and sharp hop bite that is not particularly to style but that is nevertheless fairly nice to drink. I think Id prefer a bit more authenticity and a bit more focus on getting the malt-driven flavors right, but I did enjoy this one. Its just no Chuckanut.

Draft @ Naked City - served in a huge skinny pils glass; straw gold with minor yellow glow again the light; trace white head; aromas of light corn, lemony wheat, nuts; easy drinkin with grassy sweet hops, earthy, almost grainy mouthfeel; yummy light flavors with nutty lemons, light wheat; could drink this all day

Draft at Naked City.  Pours a slightly hazed light straw yellow with a perfect uniform white head.  Light pils nose with subtile grass, hay, noble hops, light white cracker...very clean and crisp.  Light grass, Nobel hops, touch of sweet, crisp.  A very clean and light pils and something that I can drink multiples of in a sitting.

On tap at Victory.  Slightly hazy pale yellow, looks just like an unfiltered pilsner should.  Smells like wheat and dry herbal hops.  Tastes dry with fresh herbal hops, mild bitterness and a gentle hit of orange.  They sure know how to make a pilsner here at Victory.
Draft @ Coles, Buffalo NY. Pale straw colored yellow pour. Saaz & sweet malt aroma. Taste is sharp pilsner malts, saaz. Clean crisp with some light sweetness. Nice pils

tap at coles- a very tasty and hoppy pils- Im not sure what the diff. is with this one and prima, but there are plenty of similarities- flowery aroma and taste- same signature crisp bitterness- highly drinkable and enjoyable. The haze was a bit strange for a pilsner, but further research indicated that this was normal and stylistically appropriate as this was an unfiltered "real" lager.

Draft at Publick House. Pours a hazy pale yellow color with a foamy white head. Nose is light straw and grass with some nice dirty toasted malt notes. Palate is full and fizzy. Flavor of grass and straw with some light corn notes and a clean finish.

Fresh on tap from Victory, nice yellow gold pour with good white rocky foam head and lacing.  Great hops notes and a cool smooth malt taste, a nice treat on the palate.  Well balanced with no real bitterness just hops peeking in throughout.  Good stuff from Vic!
clear gold, medium white head, some lace.  nose of grassy hops and sweet malt.  flavor is bitter hops, with sweet malty notes beneath.  medium bodied, bitter finish.  this is one nice pils.

On tap The Publick House - Boston, MA. Pours a very clear pale gold, with a thin rim in white. Aroma casts a mid-level pilsner malt. The flavors in this beer were fresh, but there was a certain lacking roundness or depth to this pilsner that I was looking for. I like a little more yeastiness and a little more pilsner creaminess. This had a super-dry, rather hoppy brightness that was enjoyable, but needed to be balanced by some more malt structure.

Pours a clear lemon yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma is crisp green apple and hops. Flavor is mild, a mix of hops and malts, at least in flavor. Definite earthy grass notes in flavor. body is light with standard carbonation.

Draft, actually at The Note for Keiths 30th.  Not like victory would do a bad pils, so needless to say it was awesome.  tasted a lot like prima, or maybe it was just me since I havent had prima in a while... Id like to taste them side by side.

On tap at the brewpub.  Pours a hazy and crisp golden.  One inch of thin, pillowy head which dissipates in a few minutes leaving no lacing.  Aroma is of grass and crisp hops.  Mouthfeel is lite and crisp, spot on for a pilsner.  Taste is also very light and smooth with a tangy bite of hops.  Grass dominates with a little bit of grapefruit from the hops.  Overall, this was an outstanding beer.  Spot on for a pilsner with a good amount of hops.  Victory just knows how to do pilsners up right.
Hazy, golden color with a thin white head. Mainly hops for the aroma - grassy with some citrus notes. Flavor is slightly sweet, high bitterness, with a malty finish. Real German feel to this one.

Draft at Speakeasy Carrboro. Pours a super clear/clean brew with almost no color. Head is one finger crackly white. Nose is citrusy, light sweet malt, a bit grassy. Flavor has a lot more bitterness than the Prima, grassy, becomes astringent, no supporting malt character, prefer the prima. Palate is bitter and mildly astringent.

Clear golden pour and a white fluffy head.  Nose is big grassy hops.  Pale malt sweetness under those bitter grassy hop notes make for a pretty decent and easy-drinking pils.  Pretty over the top on the drying bitterness for the style, but thats a good thing!
Tap at Verdugo.  Really plain.  Nose of light wheat, yeast and grain.  Color is pale yellow, like your worst nightmare.  Flavor is not substantial at all, with notes of German yeast and grain.

On tap @ Coles.  Pours a crystal clear gold with a nice white head.  Aroma is grassy with no real maltiness.  OK but not the best.  There is a bit of nice malt in the flavor before its overtaken by huge bitterness.  I would have been much happier if there was more malt character & less of that overwhelming hop.

On tap @ Victory. Golden yellow with a white head. Spicy, peppery hop aroma with a rich malt scent. The flavor is bitter and sweet with a long bitter finish. Medium to light in body with active carbonation and a clean crisp finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2010 Draft.  Pours a golden body with a thin white head.  Floral aroma and hoppy with a more dry earth like body.  Hints of pear and citrus finish is bitter and sweet.  I get some lagered notes of mild sweetness in the finish that complements the bitterness and overlaying vibrant fruit tones.  This really is a masterpiece.
RnH: tap: pours a truly clear yellow/ straw.  Very crisp!  Nice bitters, blended with florals and grassy notes.  Medium body and carbonation, very refreshing!

Brewed in the USA..... On tap at the Brewery. Pours a hazy yellow color with a medium white head. Aroma of malts, yeast, citrus and grass. Taste of yeast, soap, grass and hops. Mouthfeel is medium in body with a nice malty finish. Overall, pretty good stuff !!

Draft at Uber. Now were starting to get somewhere. Pours an attractive bright gold with some serious bursting carb, tons of nucleation columns showing. Looks like beer, by god. Decent creamy platinum blonde head. Skunky, funky (by light lager standards, not by lambic standards), weedy-herbal hop nose. Pleasantly pungent. Crisp and creamy light body. Bracing, refreshing dark skunky dank mid-palate. Plenty of flavor and refreshment here.

The aroma is malt, grass, lemon.  The appearance is slightly hazy, gold with a moderate white head.   The flavor is sweet, malty, grassy, lemony, and slightly bready.  The finish has an astringent hop bitterness.  Decent overall, different.

Wow, this is a hop bomb. By far the  hoppiest Pilsner I ever had. I had it at Tonys Place in Ivyland near Warminster, Bucks County PA.
Nice head to start with some lace due to a huge hop presence. The hops are all noble and fit the Pilsner mode/style . It should be called a "Uber Pils" except the ABV is not so high. Huge flavor from  a nice malt backbone and a hop profile that is in your face. I loved this beer and wish my light beer friends would give it a try. Another "Victory" for the great brewers from PA.

Had this on tap at Brick Store Pub. This was actually very good. Nice bright yellow with a fluffy white head. Looks great. Very nice sweet honey/hop aroma. Very pungent. I was fortunate enough to have tried this on tap. Ah...such a good beer. Nice sharp bitter hop that just cuts right through that sweet honey flavor. The honey sweet flavor is very soothing and very creamy, and then that hop flavor just punches your tongue. This leaves a nice awesome pilsner taste on your tongue. Very good beer. Somewhat creamy. Overall, this beer is awesome and I was surprised to have seen this at Brick Store. If they would bottle this I would buy it a lot more than the Prim Pils.

On tap at the Brick Store, May 2008: Pours a clear bright golden with an effervescent nicely-lacing white foamy head.  Aroma of earthy floral noble hops and some pale grainy malts.  Body starts faintly sweet and pale malty with an overly bitter, drier earthy character.  Has an average fullness, maybe a little fuller for the style.  Finishes crisp with a lot of lingering Saaz hop bitterness that limits its overall drinkability.  An ok pils.

hazy orange with large white head.  moderate carbonation.  a lot of hop bitterness up front, possibly Saaz with only mild hop flavor.  some malt character towards the end.  not very accustom to the style, but solid

ASlightly cloudy, not sure if it should be this way. Nice fluffy head. Clean and crisp. Aroma nice and citrus hops. Taste is clean and sweet with some hops. Bitterness does not linger, no bad aftertaste.

Tap at Naked City. Pours a light yellow golden with a touch of chill haze, but not necessarily unfiltered or anything. Bread malt sweetness on the aroma with a noticeable peppery hop profile. The flavor is very similar with the peppery hops lingering for a while.
on tap at uber. clear yellow gold color with  a slight bitter. lots of cereal and breads. Not great.

Beautiful golden beer with streams of lively bubbles feeding a luscious, lathery, Brussels lace topping. Fresh aroma of grain, malt and lightly hopped. Disappointed in the flavor. Some corn and styrofoam. Dry. Bitter and off tasting. Stunned to see the high ratings for this one. Decidedly a sub-par brew.
Draft at Victory - This Pils had a similar look as Prima, but lacked the sharp bitterness.  A good malty Pils more in the German Pils style.

11.16.08  On tap.  I wasn’t even sure that this was going to be a distinct beer from the Prima Pils.  In tasting, this was a very good pilsner but I don’t see much of a difference from their standard pils.  Maybe a further side-by-side tasting is required.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 On tap at Blind Tiger in NYC. Ive never seen this Victory anywhere  else before. Pours a light yellow body with some head. The aroma is some dry hops and grass. The taste is pretty smooth, easy to drink with some notes of hop and bitterness towards the finish.

RERATE:::2015:::: at Kiabacca with streets. Pours a clear golden with thin white lacing. Aroma is clean grass and malt. Mouthfeel is light and crisp with notes of grain, grass and clean malt.

Sampled on draft at the Rivertowne Inn in North Huntingdon PA this beer poured a medium yellow color with a large white head that lingered. The aroma was dryish, spicy and floral hops. The flavor was bitter, tart and crisp with notes of floral and spicy hops and light chewy malts. The finish was bitter and hoppy. Nice.

(Draught)  Pours a lightly hazy yellow body with a small white head.  Aroma of floral, grass, herbs, toasted cereal, and light citrus.  Flavor of crisp hops (grass, herbal) and toasted grain.
On tap at the brewpub. Hazy lemon with a white head. Sweet bread nose with a lemony tang to it, bit of grass. Flavor follows the nose. Decent.
On cask at GL.  Pours a clear yellow gold with a tiny white head that quickly fades.  Aroma of crisp hops and light grains.  Taste is hoppy with hints of grains.

On tap at Victory in downingtown. Definetly hoppier then expected!  Cloudy yellow in color, decent head, good lacing. Malty and hoppy. Good bitterness to it, but still light in texture. Kind of in its own category, "Light IPA"... Good summer time brew as well.

Thanks to Russ for this one.  Clear, crisp yellow body, fluffy white head, soapy filmy lacing.  Aroma is light honey, grassy, thick malt presence.  Nice honey flavor, bitter hop bite, crisp and clean.

On tap at the Bocktown.  Pale ubiquitous yellow with a decent unfading eighth inch head.  barely any aroma, just clean and fresh. Taste is certainly mild pilsner.  Comes on friendly then morhps to a more bitter lager flavor.  Eventually you are left with that pils personality on the the buds. Is not over the top in bitterness. Find it enjoyable. Finish does leave a linger character of a stronger pils.

Tasted at the May Northern California Beer Tasting. This kellerbier pours a yellow gold color from a 12oz bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is cereal and grainy, a touch wheaty. A medium bodied zwickel style beer. The malts are cereal and grainy, slightly sweet. The hops are spicy. Lively carbonation. Nice balance. Kind of bitter with a very dry finish. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is crisp and dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
Draft. Light clear yellow with german hop aroma. Tatse was the same with some grassy notes. Good lacing and asprin finish.
Hazy straw colour.  Slightly grassy, herbal nose.  Herbal, moderately bitter with a very dry finish.  Clean, light malt.
Had this on draft.Usual golen color,with aroma slightly sweet and mild hops.Taste was biscuity,light citrus and bread.Not my favorite style,yet still very good for it.

(draft) Soft white head atop cloudy golden body.  Aroma is medium sweet, bread, some nectarine, grass.  Taste is medium sweet, grassy, some earthy, bread/biscuit.  Quite bitter.  Light-medium body, some crispness.

Draft at the brewery: pour is golden amber with a white head, some hops in the aroma but I couldnt pick up a lot else, taste was mildly hoppy, smooth and dry.  Very nice beer and the first one in this style for me.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2009 Very light gold pour.  Yellow and hazy with a white head.   Nice lacing.  Lots of citrus and grain in the aroma.  Very yeast grain tast.  Dry with hops to finish.  Very good and easy to drink.

Draft @ Maxs.  Pours a hazy pale straw color; bright white head with fine-bubbled lacing; very nice pour.  Very pleasant, dry herbal and mineral hoppiness in the aroma; some sticky resinousness and juiciness from the hops, but otherwise dry.  Medium mouthfeel: lively carbonation; spicy, herbal and mineral bitterness; dry, toasty core, showing a touch of breadiness and chewy malts; excellent dry pils with generous, intricate hoppiness.

Tap at Blind Tiger. Hazy pale blonde colour with a creamy white head.  Aroma is very fresh and bright.  Loaded with fresh zesty lemony saaz hops.  Bright floral aromatics, fresh crisp pilsner malt and a kiss of sulfury crispness.  Light bodied with a crisp bitterness and lingering floral/zesty hoppy aromatics.  This beer is made for summer.

Tap @ Blind Tiger.  Pours a slightly-cloudy golden color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is malt with saaz haps and a slight citric characteristic.  Taste is the same, remaining crisp, smooth, and drinkable throughout.  Very solid pils beer.

On tap at Blind Tiger in NYC.  This one a most pleasant surprise.  Pours hazy yellow with a dense white head.  The aroma has pale pils malt, a touch of lemon and a full and rich aspect not seen in most pils.  Smells delicious.  Medium body that is crisp but and a nice fullness as well with nice soft gentle carbonation.  The flavor starts with a full pils malt and some biting hop bitterness.  The finish is very clean.  Fantastic beer.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2009 Tap at Barcade: Golden pour with a slight haze and a thin white head. Nose has a ton of spicy noble hops, along with earthy lemon peel and a bisquity malt hint. Crispy light feel. Lots of earthy saaz in the flavor. The bisquity malt character holds the body well, but the peppery nobles hops dominate with a nice bitterness. A very nice German Lager!

Draught at Bar Great Harry.  Poured a pretty looking hazy to lightly cloudy yellow/gold with a frothy white head, leaving sheets of lacing.  Floral, citrus and grassy hops in the aroma which blend with the underlying malts into a nectary/honey character.  Flavor of smooth biscuity malts with a nice slightly resiny citrus hop rub on the tongue. Full unfiltered mouthfeel.  As a hophead who enjoys unfiltered ales, this is my ideal lager.
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2008 On tap at the brewery. Hazy gold with a gorgeous white head. Earthy hop aroma. Flavor is earthy hops as well with a slight bit of fruit. Pretty smooth.

Hazy golden pour with an inch of snow white head. Lemon hop aroma, very sweet and citrusy with a few earthy hints. Flavors match the aromas. Very citrusy with a little fruit at first with a well balanced hop finish. Leaves the perfect bitter sensation!

Tap at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Cool, still blonde pour with a lasting whitecap.  Ripe peach and dry apricot aroma with an earthy touch of sweetcorn.  A little papery, but super bitter and fresh.  Wet hops lend a lovely sagebrush and grassy bitterness which wraps itself in a slow, long caress around a candy malt center.  This smacks a bit of almond and toffee sweetness.  The malt seems dirty with earthtones and crisply clean at once.  Finishes dry with a hit of Saaz.  A serious, professional pils.  With style.
Like a deluxe Lowenbrau!  Very delicious and perfect in the summer! Slightly smooth and golden in a pint.

Draught:  Very slight floral hop aroma.  You could barely smell anything it was so faint.  Poured golden in color with a medium-sized, rocky, white head that lasted pretty much throughout.  Very good lacing.  Hazy.  Sparkling.  Flavor is quite bitter.  Tastes hoppy with Pils malts, hops, and a fruit I cannot identify, but with a earthy horseblanket and funk backbone.  Light to medium body.  Sticky texture.  Lively carbonation.  Short, bitter finish.  Overall, fresh and tasty, but quite earthy.  A nice way to get into this style of Lager.

Draft at Tria. Advertised on the menu as "VICTORY BRAUMEISTER SESSION PILS" with 4.7% ABV. Hazy straw color, with a moderate sized off-white head. Very subdued malt aroma with mild hops and some grassy notes. Crisp, floral hop flavor with some honey and fruit; i got a slight hint of raspberry jam along with the hops. Finish is a bit earthy. Overall, very drinkable. It really hit the spot on a hot Philly evening.
From tap a nice golden pour with a fair amount of head.  Nice bitter pilsner taste with a quick finish.

Golden color - aroma is bready with some pleasant citrus notes.  Taste was heavy on the citrus with a nice pils malt and subtle Saaz hop flavor.  Still prefer the fresh hop version, but I still say Victory makes the best Pilses in the US.

Draft - Hop Devil Grill - Lightly hazed gold, fizzy white head.  Bready nose warms to further notes of lemon rind, citrus, and hints of pepper.  Well balanced between the lemon zest, light yeast, and peppered citrus.  LIght to medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry fruity finish.  Could pound these all day...
On tap at Hop Devil. Spicy, saaz aroma, chewy butter cookie malts. Cloudy pour. Taste has a big bite to it, mostly from the saaz, lots of biscuit, very dry.
Im pretty sure this is the braumeister that I tried, and not the harvest pils.  anyway very light in colour, body was good, had a nice hop to it towards the end and a bit of a citrus bite.

On tap at the Hop Devil Grill. Cloudy straw yellow with a smooth white head.  Light, wheaty lemon nose.  Creamy lemon parfait with a nice tang.  Lime sneaks in with bready drying.  Medium carb, medium light, but eminently drinkable.

Draft at HDG. Cloudy yellow with a small but durable head. Aroma is nice sweet malts with Saaz. Nice and bready taste with a nice, dry finish. This is an awesome brew and IMHO a tad better then Prima.

Sampled at Issacs with Stegosaurus. Golden Pour with thin white head. Barely any aroma but a mild hop presence is detected(Very Mild) Slight citrus/ floral taste. A little bland and a little thin for my taste but not horrible.

On tap at the mellow mushroom in Charlotte. Pours out a murky yellow with a big white head. Smell is very nice of subdued hops and some startchy aroma that was very pleasing. Taste is heavier than expected than expected but still clean. I liked this alot. Mouthfeel is thicker than one would think as well and lets you know that there is something to this beer. Flavor hops and bittering hops come well together and the carbonation seemed just about perfect. Definatley would have this again.

On tap at the mellow mushroom in Charlotte.  Pours out a bright yellow color with a huge thick white head on it.  Smell is hops, bread, some wheat? and plenty of malts.  Taste is sweet but not as crisp and refreshing as prima pils is.  Pretty thick in most ways, interesting, and my first of this style.  This would probably be pretty good in the middle of the summer.  Not bad
Grassy hopped aroma smells just as it tastes, but with a bready flat flavor beneath  the bitterness.  Not my favorite style, but certainly a reasonable example thereof.
Tasty pils, full bodied at 5.5%, and not as crisp as the prima.  This is more of a thick pilsener and here is called a landbier, which makes sense, more lagerish than pils-ish.
on tap-pours a creamy white head with slightly hazy pale yellow color.  Aroma is grain.  Taste is grain, slight biting hops with a flat finish.  Good carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2006 Sampled from growler.   Im starting to realize that a fresh Pilsner is one heck of a beer. After having so many that have been anything less than fresh it is beers like this that are making me enjoy the style more and more.  Pours a lightly hazy golden straw with an average foamy white head that left spotty lacing.  Aroma of pilsner malts, grains, grass, floral hops and lemon.  Flavor is crisp, clean and refreshing...bitter hop presence up front, grass, malts, some grapefruit and grains.  Very well done Pilsner.

On tap at Victory. Poured a medium golden color with a smaller sized white head. Aromas of grass with some malts. Tastes of the same. I have to wonder if some of the hoppiness is starting to fade as I found both the aromas and tastes on the mellow side. Creamy body that went down very easy.

Tap. Really good Pilsner.  Good golden color, could use more sparkle.  Malty taste with some hops as well.  The malts are really effective in the taste.  This is a spectacular Pilsner in my opinion.  Might be my favorite one to date.

A very intriguing beer...on tap at Victory. A Saaz aroma with a nice foamy head and a cloudy straw color. The flavor is well balanced with malt and some hop bitterness, another very intersting brew from victory

An interesting beer on tap at Victory. Reminiscent of Prima Pils, but less bitter with more fruity esthers coming through. Much grassier as well. Slightly cloudy yellow with thin head. green malts coming through. Not horrible, not great. Decent.
On tap at Victory.  Solid pilsner, which is hard for me to say.  Usually this style is exceptionally boring, but this one, surprisingly, had quite a bit going on.  Good bitterness for a pils.
On tap at Andys. Cloudy yellow in color with a nice white head. Yeasty aroma. Malty flavor with a nice hop bitterness. Nice hop flavor. Good beer. Enjoyable.
Tap at Andys. Cloudy yellow with a white head. Hoppy sulfur/yeasty aroma. Malty flavor wuth good hop flavor and bitterness. Yeasty notes in flavor.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: UPDATED: OCT 2, 2004 tap @ Victory. The gal said "they just tapped the keg". Decent white head but fell fairly quick, min lace, clear pale gold color, moderate carbonation. This was a nice pils. Been a long time since I had a good one. Dry, nice bitterness, It had a Hallertauer type hop flavor and bitterness ( Probably Saaz though). Very clean, fresh, and a bit nippy w a pleasant crisp sharpness. Nicely balanced with enough malt to back up the hops. Very refreshing.

On tap at the brewery.  Pours pale gold with a medium head.  Aroma of malt, hops, some honey.  Tastes malty, with some hops, and a nice, honey malt sweetness at the finish, while retaining a smooth, crisp finish.  For my money this one is more flavorful than Prima Pils.  Nice balance and super complexity.

On tap at the brewery.  Grainy aroma with a sour hoppiness in there.  This is interesting.  Transparent applejuice color with a small white head.  Tangy start bittering into quite a hoppy finish.  Seems a little overhopped, but I guess this particular type of pils is supposed to be hoppy.
Pretty comparable to the Prima Pils, golden color, very clean appearance, nice bubbly white head, nose full of hops & floral notes, very crisp, medium body, excellently balanced, great session beer
Gold, nose a bit lemony and malty.  Malty sweet and a bit bready, good hops at the end, but pleasantly restrained, not quite as assertive as Prima.

Super earthy aroma, some peppery notes.  Unfiltered, looks like a weizen.  Thick, bitterish taste--scrambled eggs with pepper--no joke!  *Wierd* aftertaste that I cant quite place.  Alright.  Not as good as the Prima.

Poured a hazy golden color with a small white head and very light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of citrus hops, grass and lemon as well.  Light lemony taste, some citrus hops, and lightly tart, very earthy finish.  The only thing I did not like was the relatively strange earthy aftertaste, could have been a little fruitier.  Light carbonation.  A nice Keller pils, though I think I enjoy Sly Foxs better.
